content: teddy bear rollneck sweater by jordynn jack gauge 18 sts & 26 row over 4 finished measurements approximately 4 inches long and 6 inches wide should fit any medium sized bear for reference the bear in the picture measures about 8 tall when sitting materials needles size 8 5mm circular needles 16 and either an additional size 8 5mm circular or doublepointed needles in size 8 5mm yarn paton s classic wool merino approximately ¼ skein or probably less any worsted weight yarn will do shown in 00229 natural mix pattern notes the teddy bear rollneck sweater is worked from the top down using raglan shaping no seaming required the rollneck is simply formed by knitting everything in stockinette with no ribbing or borders this makes it a super easy and quick knit pattern using doublepointed needles or double circular method cast on 36 stitches join to work in round to shape the collar knit in stockinette stitch for 9 rounds begin raglan shaping place markers k3 pm k12 pm k6 pm k12 pm k to end of round start raglan increases *k to 1 st before marker kfb sm kfb repeat from * to last marker k to end of round repeat raglan increases on every round for 8 rounds separate sleeves place sleeve stitches on scrap yarn join and work body in round for 2 5 or until desired length bind off sleeves using doublepointed needles or double circular method move sleeve sts from scrap yarn to needles and begin working in stockinette stitch at the end of the first round pick up 7 stitches under armpit continue working in stockinette stitch only decrease two stitches on the following row and every other row for 3 times total as follows k1 k2tog knit to last three stitches of round ssk k1 continue until sleeves measure 2 from armpit or desired length bind off finishing weave in ends block if desired but seriously are you really going to block something that goes on a stuffed animal copyright 2008 jordynn jack/the knitty professors jjack@email unc edu www knittyprofessors com
